unit_learning_outcomes.description: Appreciate the multidisciplinary nature of health problems.
Appreciate the multifactorial nature of health problems and differential impacts of health issues on various groups within society.
Have an understanding of the diverse range of health issues in Australia.
Know how to access key research findings relating to infant and child health.
Understand basic strategies to prevent or intervene.
Understand different approaches to health from international policy to individual choice.
Know how to access and use key early childhood, school and government documents relating to health.
Acquire basic skills in teaching young children about health and developing safe but challenging learning environments.
Understand their own knowledge and biases regarding health issues.

assessments.description: Online Quiz (1hr) with 10 multiple choice questions.
A 2 hour exam (plus 10 mins reading time), combining 30 x multiple choice and 3 short answer questions (approx. 1.5 A4-page answers). Questions cover lecture, reading and tutorial content.

Critical Evaluation (1800 words) on a relevant health issue e.g. energy consumed through sugar in drinks; socioeconomic status and food choices.  The essay topics are designed to expose students to high quality Australian research and raise awareness of large Australian studies as well as helping students understand the multifactorial nature of contemporary health issues.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit examines health, wellbeing, nutrition and safety of children from infancy to 12 years. Implications for children, families and communities are addressed, including practices in a range of settings. Issues and debates arising from research, available technology, community attitudes and values are critically examined. This unit introduces students to the syllabus content associated with the personal development, health and physical education (PDHPE) key learning area with particular focus on the safe living, personal health choices, and growth and development strands, as well as emotional health. Skills and knowledge in planning, teaching and assessing PDHPE programs are examined, including modifications to the curriculum to meet the needs of diverse learners.
data.title: Health and Wellbeing

description: This unit examines health, wellbeing, nutrition and safety of children from infancy to 12 years. Implications for children, families and communities are addressed, including practices in a range of settings. Issues and debates arising from research, available technology, community attitudes and values are critically examined. This unit introduces students to the syllabus content associated with the personal development, health and physical education (PDHPE) key learning area with particular focus on the safe living, personal health choices, and growth and development strands, as well as emotional health. Skills and knowledge in planning, teaching and assessing PDHPE programs are examined, including modifications to the curriculum to meet the needs of diverse learners.
title: Health and Wellbeing
